fields.summary: Ability to view system info for Confluence in OnDemand

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When inserting wiki markup in a template, it fails and displays a dialog box entitled "Wiki Markup Conversion Errors", and the message "error:".

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to Browse > Confluence Admin > Global Templates
# Click "Add Template"
# Click "Insert > Wiki Markup"
# Enter any wiki markup into the dialog
# Click "Insert"
# Observe error

h4. Workaround

Use the editor's interface instead of entering wiki markup.
fields.summary: Insert wiki markup in a template causes wiki markup conversion errors

fields.description: Currently every user in a Crowd directory is synced into Confluence, regardless of whether they can access the application or not. Because of the changes made in [CONF-6404|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6404] this will now create a People Directory entry for each of these users, despite them not being able to access the application.
fields.summary: Only create an entry in the People Directory for users who can access the application.
Allow groups and users synced from a Crowd directory to be filtered

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27853].
  {panel}

If you enlarge an image and press back, the page changes but the image remains up (and the shrink effect makes the image disappear into the top left corner).

We should either...

a. Opening an image makes a history state change and back closes the image or
b. Back closes the image and automatically takes the user back too

I have a feeling that item a might be better as it may be useful for people to share the URL of an image. In this way too, it can be synced back to the attachment view page (which I assume exists).
fields.summary: If user presses "back" when an image is up, it should hide the image.
The diff color choices clashes with default cell background colors
Confluence lies about when a generated backup will be deleted
Hide Tools Menu and Attachments from a Specific Group
Add ability to set default sorting appearance for tables in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27845].
  {panel}

Currently, a page title is represented with an absolute url in mail notification for page edit and comment. For example: http://localhost:8099/display/TEST/new+again

So, when the page is moved to another space, the url/path has changed for example to http://localhost:8099/display/ds/new+again. When a user click on the page title link in the mail notification, he/she will be redirected to the old url and will be getting Page Not Found.

To improve this, we should make use of tiny url instead, like the one we used in shared page and mention mail notification. Here is the example:
!mail.png!
fields.summary: Replace absolute url with tiny url in mail notification of page edit and comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27844].
  {panel}

For each page in the Page Tree that has children, add after the page name the total number of child pages (including childs of childs...).

Home Page (3)
  First Child (1)
     Sub Page
  Next Child
fields.summary: Add page counts in Page Tree Macro

fields.description: h3.Steps To Reproduce # Take a screenshot and paste that into Confluence's Editor directly (Ctrl+V while editing) - image is pasted into page from clipboard # Resize that image in the Confluence Editor # Save the page # Export the space via HTML Export Try to view the page with that screenshot in the HTML Export. Notice that the screenshot is not rendered at all. Looking at the HTML source, this is the source when the image is pasted from clipboard, and resized (not working): {code} {code} This, on the other hand, is the source when the image is attached using the Image macro ({{Insert >> Image >> Browse >> Insert}} (in the editor) and resized (working): {code} {code} But notice the missing confluence-thumbnail class? Either way, the image is still rendered correctly with the correct thumbnail size as the width is set correctly. Another thing to note is that even if the image is pasted from clipboard, if the image is not resized (hence, not a thumbnail), the image is rendered correctly in the HTML export.

fields.description:
h5. Summary
After upgrading to Confluence 3.5 or higher, where the user property migration (e.g. {{com.atlassian.confluence.user.migration.AtlassianUserDataMigrator#migrateUserProperties}} or {{com.atlassian.user.util.migration.OSUCrowdEntityMigrator#migratePropertySet}}) won't happen/called during the upgrade which is expected for the following scnearios:
- [Upgrading to Confluence with JIRA User Management|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZAEMDg]

.....user settings ({{confluence.user.*}}) in {{OS_PROPERTYENTRY}} table will be lost such as:
* Profile picture
* Default setting of editor (wikimarkup/RTE)
* User site home page
* Login details
* etc.

h5. Possible Cause
The upgrade process does not migrate the respective entities in {{OS_PROPERTYENTRY}} table. They are no more taken into account due to different structure - previously the {{entity_name}} is {{OSUser_user}} (and {{entity_id}} set to JIRA's {{userbase.id}}) and now is {{CWD_username}} ({{entity_id}} set to 0).
* Mismapped {{OS_PROPERTYENTRY}} entries of JIRA users

fields.description:
h5. Description
When you have internal user called 'foobar' for quite sometime. Then one day you integrated Confluence with LDAP and use it as the top priority User Directory. However, the username of the same user in LDAP is 'FooBAr'. This would cause these issues:
# Any Global/Space Permission or Page Restriction that was explicitly set to  'foobar' (individual permission, not by his/her group) will now break for 'FooBAr' (doesn't apply any more)
# Possibly some other issues where Confluence is dependant on user's {{user_name}} instead of user's {{lower_user_name}}

h5. Expected Behaviour
By right, when there is same user coexist in multiple User Directories, but with different username letter case, Confluence should take it as one user rather than 2 different user. Which means, the mentioned problems above shouldn't exist, by right.

h5. Possible Cause
It seems that, in few things/places, Confluence still depends/refers to user's {{cwd_user.user_name}} instead of user's {{cwd_user.lower_user_name}}.
fields.summary: Multiple issues affecting users that coexist in multiple user directories with different username letter case

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27825].
  {panel}

*Atlassian edit*
If you use the insert JIRA Issue Macro to create an issue on a confluence page, it only takes the default required fields into account. If you have defined any other fields in your field configuration to be a required field, it will not show up in the macro. When trying to create the issue, the error message as described above will appear.

*Original report*

We have the following setup:
* Confluence 4.2.13
* Jira 5.2.2
* Greenhopper 6.1.0

Confluence and Jira are trusted applications.

When we try to create a new epic via the Jira-Issues-Macro we get the following error message:

{panel}
There were errors creating an issue in JIRA. Some required fields may not be available on this form. Try creating this issue in JIRA

* customfield_10301: Epic Name is required
* Epic Name is required.
{panel}

With all other issue-types this works perfectly. 
Now we discovered, that the field "Epic Name" is a custom-field from Greenhopper and is mandatory. But with the Jira-Issue-Macro you cannot create Issues with customized mandatory fields. Now, the point is that we have not customized the field "Epic-Name", this comes form the Greenhopper installation. And Greenhopper needs an value in this field to work properly.

The feature to be able to create JIRA-Issues out of Confluence is very important for our business-process and furthermore it would be nice if you can define mandatory fields as you like and they appear in Confluence in the Jira-Issue-Macro-Wizard. 
Are there any workarounds for this bug?

greetings
Benjamin
fields.summary: Error when trying to create an Issue via Jira-Issues-Macro (required fields)

fields.description:
To reproduce:

I am using Crowd (2.4.0) for authentication with Confluence (4.2.2). I have an employee who left the company so I removed him from all groups in Crowd and disabled his account. His email is forwarded to another, current employee so that we don't miss any emails sent to his old address. Confluence is still sending the recommended updates email to this disabled user's email address, and so they are being forwarded to the user who is receiving his email.

Expected result:

Disabled users and/or users in no groups should not receive Confluence recommended updates emails.

Actual result:

User who is disabled and in no groups is still receiving Confluence recommended updates email on a daily basis.
fields.summary: Disabled users still get Recommended Updates email

fields.description:
See related bug CONF-2487. It seems that the very same problem is still valid when an attachment has a file name containing special characters (like ä,ö,ü) *and* spaces. In this case when downloading the attachement file, all spaces are replaced by "+" signs. If documents have no special characters, the spaces are preserved on download - as expected.

This is problematic, especially because if this document having "+" instead of spaces is then edited and re-uploaded to the wiki page, it is not recognized as new version of the original document but as a *new* document because of the different file name.

I could not find a hint that this has been fixed/altered in the bug fix issus for 4.3.x so I assume this is still present in current 4.3.6 version.
(Althoug CONF-22338 has been fixed in the mean time.)

Note that this issue seems Firefox specific (like CONF-12671), with IE there is no such problem.
fields.summary: Attachments having special characters have spaces replaced by + in their filenames on download

fields.description:
*Problem Description*
The page tree on the left side of documentation theme is missing if dynamic task list 2 macro is used. This issue seems to affect those user that doesn't have comment permission, as it seems that the quick comment will load the rest of batch java script with the page tree on the left, which is not the intended behaviour. This issue can be replicated in Confluence 4.3.

When the quick comment stops to load, it seems that it stops the rest of the js to be loaded.
{noformat}
QuickComment.TopLevel: binding 1 element(s) to the 'click' event. batch.js:23
QuickComment.Reply: binding 1 reply link(s) to the 'click' event. batch.js:23
Uncaught ReferenceError: disabled is not defined confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2:web-resources.js:347
(anonymous function) confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2:web-resources.js:347
e.extend.each batch.js:3
e.fn.e.each batch.js:3
(anonymous function) confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2:web-resources.js:347
e.extend.each batch.js:3
e.fn.e.each batch.js:3
(anonymous function) confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2:web-resources.js:345
e.resolveWith batch.js:3
e.extend.ready batch.js:3
c.addEventListener.C batch.js:3
QuickComment: instigated background loading of the comment editor. 
{noformat}

*Steps to replicate*
# Create a space
# Create a page with a dynamic tasklist macro in this space
# Create a user 
# Assign user membership only to confluence-users
# Make sure that confluence-users group has *VIEW access only* to this space, no comments, nothing, and no rights to anonymous
# Login as this user, and navigate to the page with the dynamic tasklist macro

*Workaround*
Add the comment permission to the user and this will allow the rest of the JS scripts to be loaded.
fields.summary: Dynamic tasklist macro eliminates page tree on the documentation theme when the user has no comment permission on the space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27784].
  {panel}

Hey guys,

We really like the new task and notification features in Confluence. It really gets close to be a complete project management tool for us. But a way to log time and track it through charts and graphs would be great addition. 

Let me give some insight into how we are using it. We are a software development company, so the way we use JIRA and Confluence is much like you, I would imagine. Our developers use JIRA primarily to track their tasks and report time, etc. 

However, the non-tech side of our company (PR, Marketing, Client Services, Administrative) is currently trying to use JIRA for time tracking as well. With the new updates to Confluence, we can really move a lot of our processes (project tasks, collaboration) to Confluence, but we're still having to go to JIRA to log time and our directors have to go there to track their teams' time. 

Are their plans to allow time tracking and reporting capabilities in Confluence, making it a project "management" suite like Basecamp instead of just a collaboration tool? And if so, when?

Thanks a lot

h4. Expected behaviour
Missing directory of an attachment draft shouldn't prevent one from creating or copying a page.

h4. Workaround
Create the missing directory manually as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/IQhNEg]
fields.summary: Page creation or copying failed when there is an attachment draft directory that does not exist
Provide a way for administrators to change Confluence's default time zone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27775].
  {panel}

This happens quite often.

* Delete some linked text.
* Replace it with other linked text.
* Save the page.
* The linked text reappears, and is conjoined to the new text.

Note: Knowing that this happens often, I go to great pains to check that the link really has gone, before adding the new text. I move my cursor, and check that the link properties dialog does not pop up. Still, on occasions like this one, the linked text reappeared anyway.
fields.summary: Deleted link reappears

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27767].
  {panel}

Interface #1. Drag and drop window appears:
- When choosing Add, Attachment in page View mode
- When choosing Insert, Image in page Edit mode

Interface #2. Choose File only appears:
- When choosing insert, attachment in page Edit mode

This is confusing and causes me to switch modes when adding files.  Please elimnate Interface #2 and always use Interface #1, allowing drag and drop in all contexts.
fields.summary: Inconsistent Add Attachment Interface Between Workflows/Contexts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27761].
  {panel}

When creating a Pie Chart Macro from within Confluence the list of filters matching certain criteria is truncated to 20 lines.  This includes the "Filters" item at the top of the box.

This is challenging for similarly names filters.  The attachments show 40 filters all names with the same prefix.  Not all of these filters are viewable within the Confluence pie chat macro.

This is not that big of a problem in this instance, but becomes increasingly more important for items of the following format

"Prefix-12May2012-otherinformation"
fields.summary: JIRA Pie Chart Macro Truncates List of Filters

fields.description:
To toggle the left-hand navigation bar, when the space is using the Documentation Theme, the shortcut is '[' as per the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Keyboard+Shortcuts].

However using German (Austria) Keyboard Layout, user had to enter ß as keyboard-shortcut instead of ALTGR-8 which represent '['. The mapping is different.
fields.summary: Had to enter ß to toggle the left-hand navigation bar, when the space is using the Documentation Theme instead of ALTGR-8 when using German (Austria) Keyboard Layout

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Attach an image with different mime type. For example: {{image/x-citrix-pjpeg}}.
# If you don't have an image with that mime type, just attach any image and change the mime type to {{image/x-citrix-pjpeg}}. You can do this by going to *Tools > Attachments > Properties*
# Display the image as a thumbnail

h4. Expected Results
The image is displayed as expected and when clicking the image to zoom in, it will show the larger version. This works in both Firefox and Chrome.

h4. Actual Results
The image is not displayed and the message "The requested content cannot be loaded. Please try again later." is shown when clicking on the image

!screenshot.jpg!

h4. Environment Information

IE 8 and IE 9

h4. Workaround

# Backup your Confluence database
# Run a SQL query to change the MIME type of all images in the database. For example:

This query changes all images with MIME TYPE {{image/x-citrix-pjpeg}} to {{image/jpeg}}
{code:sql}UPDATE ATTACHMENTS SET CONTENTTYPE = 'image/jpeg' WHERE CONTENTTYPE = 'image/x-citrix-pjpeg';{code}

This query changes all images with MIME TYPE {{image/x-citrix-gif}} to {{image/gif}}
{code:sql}UPDATE ATTACHMENTS SET CONTENTTYPE = 'image/gif' WHERE CONTENTTYPE = 'image/x-citrix-gif';{code}
fields.summary: Thumbnails are not working in IE if images do not match extension
Default title for images pasted from the clipboard is incompatible with "Download All".

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. In a page add a heading text that contains a colon, e.g. "Q: What is this?"
2. Try creating a link to this heading - open Insert Link dialog, Advanced tab and in the Link field type "#Q:Whatisthis?".

Expected behavior is to be able to use the colon character, but it is not possible since it's used to delimit spacekey from pagename of the link.
fields.summary: Can not link to a heading that contains a colon (:)

fields.description:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27754].
  {panel}

h4. Symptoms

When you copy a link to a Confluence page, as per [our instructions here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Linking+to+Pages#LinkingtoPages-Copyingandpastingalinkfromyourwebbrowser], the link is created as a web URL link, rather than a normal space/page link. The result of this is:

# If you go to the linked page's info, that link is not listed as incoming
# If the page linked is ever renamed, then that link will not be automatically changed to the new location

This also happens if you are copying and pasting images that are stored as attachments in Confluence. In [our documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/OganDg], it's mentioned that you can drag and drop images into the editor, which is the same as copy and paste.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Follow the steps [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Linking+to+Pages#LinkingtoPages-Copyingandpastingalinkfromyourwebbrowser] to copy and paste a link into a page
# Click on the link, and then click Edit, to find that it's a web URL link

h4. Workaround

Instead of copying and pasting the link, create the link manually.
fields.summary: Copying and pasting a link to a Confluence page results in a web URL link instead of a space/page link

{code}

This can sometimes be caused by the [Gravatar for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.vicox.confluence.plugins.gravatar] plugin. This is because the way the gravatar plugin works is to intercept the url http://confluence:8090/confluence/images/icons/profilepics/gravatar.png?md5=hash, and redirect it to gravatar. But this url happens to match the url for uploaded avatar, and so the code path for dealing with uploaded avatar is used. But of course, such a file doesn't exist, and so the NullPointerException occurs.

Essentially this is a problem with the gravatar plugin - it should not try to hijack the url for uploaded avatars, and use its own unique url scheme for avatars. However, the plugin does not have vendor support provided. We have emailed the issue to the vendor, but can't guarantee that it will be addressed.

h3. Workaround
* Disable the Gravatar plugin. 
* NB: At the time of writing the plugin is only compatible up to Confluence 4.2.13, so if you're experiencing this issue on 4.3 or above, please disable and remove the plugin completely.
fields.summary: Avatar handling in likes should check for null

It converts or strips out many of the images in the doc. The page ends up with a lot of attachments, but no conversion.
